name: Ranger Vs Monk in a Monk,Ranger/Cleric/Rogue build: APR, AC
author: Asturonethoriusaline

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Hey Hi all. I got a question for the expert builders here.

In a. Dex X/Cleric/Rogue type build, is Ranger a Viable alternative to Monk?

Ranger would give Dex Cleric/Rogue build Two Weapon, Ambidexterity feats for free at 1st level, making it so that a 2 Weapon build would only need to take improved 2 weapon feat, instead of all 3 feats, freeing up slots for other feats.

Ranger 1, would also give +1 AB Pre Epic, and 4 APR. And good skills, and favored enemy.

The only problems with Ranger 1 in that kind of build is the loss of the 5 AC thru 20 Wisdom in a Monk/Cleric/Rogue build.

And since can get 4 APR thru Divine Power spell, does that make taking Ranger 1 Pre Epic, Redundant, because already get 4 APR thru Divine Power, and so Ranger 1 not needed to get 4 APR?

Is there a way to get that 5 AC back that lost by not taking Monk 1, and taking Ranger 1 instead?

Does Ranger 1 giving 2 weapon feats, and favored enemy, enough by itself, because of Divine Power 4 APR, to make it a viable alternative.

I think that if can find a way to get back that lost 5 AC, that it could be a viable alternative.

But I dont know. Maybe it would still be viable even without the lost 5 AC, and even if Divine Power gives 4 APR without Ranger 1.

Thoughts. Answers. Help?

Thanks.

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content: I believe that the feats gained via Ranger, do not qualify one for Improved Two weapon Fighting...unfortunately.

posts.author: Ten Pura
posts.content: Ranger 9 gives Improved Two-Weapon Fighting for free. Unfortunately, this would probably not be ideal in build you're working on.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: In the Ranger example, you actually don't want 4 APR in a Cleric build, as DP gives that extra APR - but at full AB, rather than -15 AB. Also, with the Monk example, if you use kamas or fist, Monk UBAB means not only are the number of your attacks increased, they decrease by in their likelihood to hit by -3 per attack rather than -5.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Going Rang9 for dual-wielding is almost always a waste when you can use Figh4 to get all three dual-wielding feats. There are some cases where Rang9 is useful, but in general Fighter is almost always a better choice than Ranger if you only want dual-wielding feats.

Rog13/Cler26/Figh1 or Rog13/Cler25/Figh2 would give you 1/2 dual-wielding feats, but there's no way to make up for the APR and AC loss of dropping Monk. You could also go for a Rog13/Cler26/Rang1 and use the bonus Ranger feat for Epic Prowess / EWF which would allow you to reshuffle feats. However, as gkorjax said you can't use Rang1 to qualify for ITWF. Even if you did use these class spreads you wouldn't be able to go beyond 15 BAB anyway so you would still have 3 APR (which is a good thing for a cleric).

posts.author: Asturonethoriusaline
posts.content:
Thanks you all. I kind of thought some of those things. Didnt know about those things.

And now I know, which is why I asked.

So Ranger, and Fighter are not good alternatives to Monk, and Monk is better in a Monk 1/Cleric 26/Rogue type of build.

Thanks

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
One more important thing is that Monk gives you Wisdom AC, which is part of why this class combo is very strong. If you have 20 WIS, and with items and buffs reach 32, that's an extra 11 points of AC in a build with Epic Dodge.

Very, very good AC!
